what: Statistical Analysis of Mixed Ploidy Populations
title: Statistical Analysis of Mixed Ploidy Populations
text: Luke W Pembleton StAMPP R package Statistical Analysis Mixed Ploidy Populations. allows users calculate pairwise Nei’s Genetic Distances (Nei 1972), pairwise Fixation Indexes (Fst) (Weir & Cockerham 1984) also Genomic Relationship matrixes following Yang et al. (2010) mixed single ploidy populations. Bootstrapping across loci implemented Fst calculation generate confidence intervals p-values around pairwise Fst values. StAMPP utilises SNP genotype data ploidy level (ability handle missing data) coded utilise multithreading available allow efficient analysis large datasets. StAMPP able handle genotype data genlight objects allowing integration packages adegenet.

title: Statistical Analysis of Mixed Ploidy Populations

what: Convert StAMPP genotype data to genlight object — stampp2genlight
title: Convert StAMPP genotype data to genlight object — stampp2genlight
text: Converts StAMPP formated allele frequency data frame generated stamppConvert function genlight object use packages

title: Convert StAMPP genotype data to genlight object — stampp2genlight
Convert StAMPP genotype data to genlight object — stampp2genlight
text: geno data frame containing allele frequency data generated stamppConvert pop logical. True population IDs present StAMPP genotype data, False population IDs absent.

title: Convert StAMPP genotype data to genlight object — stampp2genlight
text: object class genlight contains genotype data, individual IDs, population IDs (present) ploidy levels

title: Convert StAMPP genotype data to genlight object — stampp2genlight
text: StAMPP exports genlight objects able handle mixed ploidy datasets unlike genpop genloci objects. genlight object allows intergration StAMPP common R packages ADEGENET

title: Convert StAMPP genotype data to genlight object — stampp2genlight
text: Luke Pembleton <lpembleton barenbrug.com>

title: Convert StAMPP genotype data to genlight object — stampp2genlight
code: # import genotype data and convert to allele frequecies data(potato.mini, package="StAMPP") potato.freq <- stamppConvert(potato.mini, "r") # Convert the StAMPP formatted allele frequency data frame to a genlight object potato.genlight <- stampp2genlight(potato.freq, TRUE)

title: Analysis of Molecular Variance — stamppAmova
text: Calculates AMOVA based genetic distance matrix stamppNeisD() using amova() function package PEGAS exploring within population variation

title: Analysis of Molecular Variance — stamppAmova
text: dist.mat matrix genetic distances individuals generated stamppNeisD() geno data frame containing allele frequency data generated stamppConvert, genlight object containing genotype data, individual IDs, population IDs ploidy levels perm number permutations tests hypotheses

title: Analysis of Molecular Variance — stamppAmova
text: object class "amova" list containing table sum square deviations (SSD), mean square deviations (MSD) number degrees freedom well variance components

title: Analysis of Molecular Variance — stamppAmova
text: Uses formula distance ~ populations, calculate AMOVA population differentiation within & population variation. function uses amova function PEGAS package.

title: Analysis of Molecular Variance — stamppAmova
text: Paradis E (2010) pegas: R package population genetics integrated-modular approach. Bioinformatics 26, 419-420. <doi:10.1093/bioinformatics/btp696>

title: Analysis of Molecular Variance — stamppAmova
text: Luke Pembleton <lpembleton barenbrug.com>

title: Analysis of Molecular Variance — stamppAmova
code: # import genotype data and convert to allele frequecies data(potato.mini, package="StAMPP") potato.freq <- stamppConvert(potato.mini, "r") # Calculate genetic distance between individuals potato.D.ind <- stamppNeisD(potato.freq, FALSE, "standard") # Calculate AMOVA stamppAmova(potato.D.ind, potato.freq, 100) #>  #> 	Analysis of Molecular Variance #>  #> Call: amova(formula = dist.mat ~ pop.names, nperm = perm) #>  #>                  SSD         MSD df #> pop.names 0.10567200 0.052835998  2 #> Error     0.01207841 0.004026136  3 #> Total     0.11775040 0.023550081  5 #>  #> Variance components: #>              sigma2 P.value #> pop.names 0.0244049  0.0891 #> Error     0.0040261         #>  #> Phi-statistics: #> pop.names.in.GLOBAL  #>           0.8583896  #>  #> Variance coefficients: #> a  #> 2  #>

title: Import and Convert — stamppConvert
text: Imports biallelic AB formated allele frequency genotype data. data imported biallelic AB format function also converts allele frequencies

title: Import and Convert — stamppConvert
text: genotype.file genotype input file. R matrix object file path csv file containing genotype data either bialleleic AB format allele '' frequency format, genlight object containing genotype data type type file genotype data imported ; "csv" = comma seperated file, "r" = data frame R workspace, "genlight" = genlight object.

title: Import and Convert — stamppConvert
text: object class data.frame contains allele frequency data use StAMPP functions

title: Import and Convert — stamppConvert
text: Luke Pembleton <lpembleton barenbrug.com>

title: Import and Convert — stamppConvert
code: # Import example data into the R workspace data(potato.mini, package="StAMPP") # Convert to allele frequencies potato.freq <- stamppConvert(potato.mini, "r")

title: Fst Computation — stamppFst
text: function calculates pairwise Fst values along confidence intervals p-values populations according method proposed Wright(1949) updated Weir Cockerham (1984)

title: Fst Computation — stamppFst
text: geno data frame containing allele frequency data generated stamppConvert, genlight object containing genotype data, individual IDs, population IDs ploidy levels nboots number bootstraps perform across loci generate confidence intervals p-values percent percentile calculate confidence interval around nclusters number proccesor treads cores use calculations.

title: Fst Computation — stamppFst
text: object list components: Fstsa matrix pairwise Fst values populations Pvaluesa matrix p-values pairwise Fst values containined 'Fsts' matrix Bootstrapsa dataframe Fst value generated Bootstrapping associated confidence intervals nboots<2, bootstrapping performed therefore matrix Fst values returned.

title: Fst Computation — stamppFst
text: possible, using multiple processing threads cores recommended assist calculating Fst values large number bootstraps.

title: Fst Computation — stamppFst
text: Wright S (1949) Genetical Structure Populations. Annals Human Genetics 15, 323-354. <doi:10.1111/j.1469-1809.1949.tb02451.x> Weir BS, Cockerham CC (1984) Estimating F Statistics ANalysis Population Structure. Evolution 38, 1358-1370. <doi:10.2307/2408641>

title: Fst Computation — stamppFst
text: Luke Pembleton <lpembleton barenbrug.com>

title: Fst Computation — stamppFst
code: # import genotype data and convert to allele frequecies data(potato.mini, package="StAMPP") potato.freq <- stamppConvert(potato.mini, "r") # Calculate pairwise Fst values between each population potato.fst <- stamppFst(potato.freq, 100, 95, 1)

title: Genomic Relationship Calculation — stamppGmatrix
text: function calculates genomic relationship matrix following method decribed Yang et al (2010)

title: Genomic Relationship Calculation — stamppGmatrix
text: geno data frame containing allele frequency data generated stamppConvert, genlight object containing genotype data, individual IDs, population IDs ploidy levels

title: Genomic Relationship Calculation — stamppGmatrix
text: object class matrix contains genomic relationship values individual

title: Genomic Relationship Calculation — stamppGmatrix
text: Yang J, Benyamin B, McEvoy BP, et al (2010) Common SNPs explain large proportion heritability human height. Nat Genet 42, 565-569. <doi:10.1038/ng.608>

title: Genomic Relationship Calculation — stamppGmatrix
text: Luke Pembleton <lpembleton barenbrug.com>

title: Genomic Relationship Calculation — stamppGmatrix
code: # import genotype data and convert to allele frequecies data(potato.mini, package="StAMPP") potato.freq <- stamppConvert(potato.mini, "r") # Calculate genomic relationship values between each individual potato.fst <- stamppGmatrix(potato.freq)

title: Genetic Distance Calculation — stamppNeisD
text: function calculates Nei's genetic distance (Nei 1972) populations individuals

title: Genetic Distance Calculation — stamppNeisD
text: geno data frame containing allele frequency data generated stamppConvert, genlight object containing genotype data, individual IDs, population IDs ploidy levels pop logical. True genetic distance calculated populations, false calculated individual measure character string defining distance measure use: "standard" Neis standard genetic distance 1972 "DA" Neis DA distance 1983.

title: Genetic Distance Calculation — stamppNeisD
text: object class matrix contains genetic distance population individual

title: Genetic Distance Calculation — stamppNeisD
text: Nei M (1972) Genetic Distance Populations. American Naturalist 106, 283-292.

title: Genetic Distance Calculation — stamppNeisD
text: Luke Pembleton <lpembleton barenbrug.com>

title: Genetic Distance Calculation — stamppNeisD
code: # import genotype data and convert to allele frequecies data(potato.mini, package="StAMPP") potato.freq <- stamppConvert(potato.mini, "r") # Calculate genetic distance between individuals potato.D.ind <- stamppNeisD(potato.freq, FALSE, "standard") # Calculate genetic distance between populations potato.D.pop <- stamppNeisD(potato.freq, TRUE, "standard")

title: Export to Phylip Format — stamppPhylip
text: Converts genetic distance matrix generated stamppNeisD Phylip format exports text file

title: Export to Phylip Format — stamppPhylip
text: distance.mat matrix containing genetic distances generated stamppNeisD converted Phylip format file file path name save Phylip format matrix

title: Export to Phylip Format — stamppPhylip
text: exported Phylip formated text file can easily imported sofware packages DARWin (Perrier & Jacquemound-Collet 2006) used generate neighbour joining trees

title: Export to Phylip Format — stamppPhylip
text: Perrier X, Jacquemound-Collet JP (2006) DARWin - Dissimilarity Analysis Representation Windows. Agricultural Research Development

title: Export to Phylip Format — stamppPhylip
text: Luke Pembleton <lpembleton barenbrug.com>

title: Export to Phylip Format — stamppPhylip
code: # import genotype data and convert to allele frequecies data(potato.mini, package="StAMPP") potato.freq <- stamppConvert(potato.mini, "r") # Calculate genetic distance between populations potato.D.pop <- stamppNeisD(potato.freq, TRUE, "standard") # Export the genetic distance matrix in Phylip format if (FALSE) stamppPhylip(potato.D.pop, file="potato_distance.txt")

title: StAMPP 1.2.0 (2014-02-26)
text: fixed error calculating Nei’s genetic distance individuals using genotype data imported ‘freq’ format; – Prior update StAMPP bug missing data ecountered print error screen calculate genetic distances. error associated data imported ‘freq’ format calculating genetic distances individuals. results data analysis StAMPP still accurate error prevented calculation genetic distance therefore incorrect values generated. corrected error calculating Nei’s genetic distance StAMPP split calculation using large datasets consequently produced memory allocation error memory limiting.
